reviewText:
Short description about the game
It's basically a TPS, in a toy universe, the soldiers, the weapons, are actual toy figures.
The environment is funny, you can see big sponges, huge candles. Basically, everything is bigger than you.

Gameplay
About 10 maps, different game modes which are all fun, you all start with the same weapons, you don't buy ammo, you don't call for 'air support', or such.
It's a pretty simple and minimal game, and i love it for that, lately i've been too annoyed about the lack of actual fun shooters/online games that are also minimal.

Community
Well, it's too early to talk about the community, but, you shouldn't consider it much, basically, toxic players are in every game.
However i made this small section in my review to tell you a funny store that happened to me earlier in this game.
Someone randomly said 'Votekick X', i tried to defend that one 'X' because it didn't seem fair since he didn't do anything. That 'X' that was votekicked, actually votekicked me and said 'lol'.

FEW CONS
First of all, the devs seem like they take care of the game, and they seem to be interested in actually solving problems, i point these out for them, in case someone slipped the details on the forums, and they actually read my review.

- Sudden loss of connection, happens basically, after almost every match, sometimes before joining one.
- The 'Find Game' option, often finds a game that is already full, which can be quite frustrating.
- There is too much invisible unwalkable space" (sorry

recommended: you can walk too close to a teammate or you will be blocked by some invisible space. Which can be bad if a teammate is AFK in some sort of small space. You can't walk past him even if there seems to be plenty of space.\n- The votekicking can use some improvement

reviewText:
The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare would probably have been my dream game when I was a kid. There were Army Men, but unfortunately I never got my hands on that game. This game makes me feel like a kid again and it's a damn good feeling. I absolutely recommend this game and here's why:

There are 10 maps and each map has it's own gamemode. There will be more maps and gamemodes coming soon according to the developers. Each map design is astonishing and the detail put into them is amazing. Sometimes you just want to look at your surroundings and appreciate the thought put into those maps. There are 6 weapons you can use which are the classic assault rifle, shotgun, rocket launcher, sniper rifle, flamethrower and a grenade. As of right now, flamethower is mostly used for objective maps rather than as a weapon, since in recent update it was nerfed pretty badly, however, shotgun is a VERY powerful weapon in close range. The game doesn't really have a big learning curve and gameplay is very simple. You just hop in a game and have a good time. If you have a friend to play with, I highly recommend it, because I find the game much more enjoyable when you play it with a friend. Soundtrack is very catchy and probably one of the best I've heard in years. Developers are very active in Community Hub and they are always there to assist you with your problem.

While I highly recommend this game, there are also things that need to be fixed. Firstly, I think that shotgun should have a nerf, since it's mostly a one shot kill from a close distance. In smaller maps people mostly use only shotgun, because there's no reason not to. Secondly, I've noticed that the flamethrower does not register its hits as much as it should. There's no use in using it as a weapon as of right now. And last thing should be progression. I like games where it's simple, but there should be something that keeps players coming back. It doesn't have to be something fancy, but at least badges or levels for your accomplishments would be a great start. Sometimes it just feels to repetitive and you don't feel satisfaction in winning a game. It does feel amazing to make a plan with your friend and succeed in it with or without a reward, though.

Overall, this is one of my favorite games and I can't wait for new content!

reviewText:
My review so far....

+ve points

No OP players due to class/upgrading weapons/spending a ton of real money getting better things - everyone starts out with the same weapons, it takes skills to master them.

Lovely graphics and the maps look beautiful - sometimes there are a few things that spoil this... but 99% of the time it looks stunning.

Good clean fun.... you turn on, go into a map and just start shooting.  I can see teams of five people, using team speak, really making something of this.   I can see tactics etc being used to win matches amongst five friends.

There are a few different game modes... the one involving the fooz table is my favourite so far... basically you have to score a goal whiles killing other army men!!

Plenty more scope... I haven’t played loads yet... but i'm gunna suggest my mates get this so we can all have a go.

-ve points

There are only 5 people on each side.

There could be more customisation/weapons to make the game more in depth.

There could be a chat function so users with microphones can communicate if they want too.

I would love to see swimming and parachutes... but maybe I am greedy!

It is difficult to get a game at this point in time... although I do realise this is brand new and not many people have got it yet. (hence I have no really factored this into my score)

reviewText:
As my childhood was all about army men games and figures, I was so excited with this game the moment I saw it, and it really does not disappoint me at all.

Pros:
+Super fun, fast pace gameplay.
+Ten different maps in total and each map has a unique objective: capture the flag, light the birthday cake candles, push the enemies' cup off the table etc. and my favourite is playing football, where each team need to put the ball in the opponent's goal while trying to blow the enemies' head off at the same time :P
+5 different weapons to switch easily between at your liking: assault rifle, sniper, shotgun, bazooka, flamethrower.
+Gorgeous graphics, and run extremely well.
+Very good and relaxing soundtrack.
+No competitive feeling, simply just fun, best thing to play after a stressful day.

Cons:
+No vehicle like tank, armoured car, mounted MG on jeep, anti-aircraft etc.
+No speciality class, no character customization.
+No bot to play with at night when everybody is sleeping, and the game has some connection issue, best way to play is browse from server and do not use the join game in the menu.

The little content aspect is actually acceptable for the price, but still it does even better than many triple A titles recently, which ask for 60 dollars but offer even less content than a 15 dollar game like this one!
For 10 dollars on sale or even when at full price I still think it's all worth it, and if you are a fan of army men you don't even need to read the review to decide, you must get it now!!

9.5/10 I love this game <3

reviewText:
Since the death of Major Mylar, the Tan army has lost every battle. Even with the help of the Blue and Grey armies, it seems that the Green are destined to win and the war finally appears to be coming to an end after so many years.
Unbeknownst to the Green however, The Insane Grey Doctor who was recently declared MIA, is still alive and has been furthering his research that he started back in the tropical zone of the plastic world, going beyond zombies and instead has found a new interest in the insects of the real world. Spawning creature after creature of the vilest order, The Grey Doctor's power only grows with each passing moment.
Seeking to capture and destroy the plastic world, The Doctor finally emerges back in the real world, with his new found army ready and at his command he launches an assault on all of the nations.
But unknown to anyone, even Plastro himself, the Grey Doctor has also recovered Major Mylar’s remains and with them, has created a weapon so powerful, it threatens the balance of both the real and the plastic worlds...

reviewText:
Yet another example of a nice, creative indie game with an extreme lack of players. There are usally about 3~7 populated servers.

8.5/10

There are 10 modes and 10 maps. In other words... One mode for one map. You can't play other game mode with said map. Every one of them is designed for their specific game mode. Everyone of them has their own (nice, happy) BGM too.

Gunplay: You have one rifle, shotgun, sniper, RPG, grenades and flamethrower.
Unless you die easily, you will be forced to use your rifle. The other weapons have a reasonably big lack of ammo (the game has ammo regen) while your rifle will have 200+ bullets. I didn't notice any bullet drop, but there is a max distance. When you are way too far apart, you won't deal damage with any weapon other than your sniper.

reviewText:
The Mean Greens is a simple shooter with some incredibly fun and unique maps.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0s1oLUZMBE0
The fact that you play as toys in this game allows for some really imaginitve objectives and maps.
For example, a kitchen map has you zipline in by a string attached to plastic cups. You battle in between gigantic doughnuts, bubbles from a sink, and your mission is to knock over the enemy cup so that they can't zipline into the level anymore. There are so many creative objectives placed on colourful and alive maps. It's a nice breath of fresh air in the shooter genre.

The gameplay itself is quite simple. You sprint, jump, shoot and roll. The combat at the moment isn't very in-depth. There are no weapon pick-ups, you just have all 5 on you at once. No killstreak rewards, or class systems. Personally, I like it. It's very simple and easy to pick up and have fun with. My only gripe at the moment is the game's cap is 5 vs 5 which leaves some of the bigger maps feeling a tad bit empty sometimes, although the devs have said they plan to raise that, as well as add more content in the future, which is great to hear!

That's really all there is to say.
Overall, simple gameplay but the fun variety of objectives and maps keeps the game fresh!

voteText: 28 of 31 people (90%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Watch the video review here!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z7oKBjPc1is&feature=youtu.be


HISTORY
Developed by Virtual Basement and Code Headquarters and published by Virtual Basement
it's The Mean Greens Plastic Warfare released in late 2015 for the PC with a PS4 and Xbox One release planned but with no announcement for a release date quiet yet as of this review.

Plastic Warfare is your not so standard 3rd person shooter, the game is purely multiplayer based, so sadly there isn't any single player or campaign mode to be found. You either create or pick a lobby, pick a side; either green or tan, you vote for a map, and the greatest war of our time begins... The fight for green or tan supremacy.

The game over all as of this review currently only has 10 maps, each map having it's own specific game mode assigned to it, ranging from capture the flag in a fish tank, to defending cookies on a train going around a Christmas tree, to my personal favorite two teams attempting to thaw out their toy dinosaurs in a freezer with flame throwers.

Each game mode and map consists of teams of 5 versus 5, theirs no specific classes or anything like that, you basically spawn with 5 weapons at your disposal, your standard rifle, shotgun, sniper rifle, missile launcher, and flamethrower; each with a set amount of ammo that will replenish with a cool down effect once used up.


But is it any good? Let's find out with...

THE GOOD
-Maps and game modes are the star of the game and extremely unique and fun to play in and explore
-Simple and easy to learn but effective gameplay with tons of variety in the game modes
-Looks fantastic and runs smoothly even on mid-tier computers


Probably the best part about Plastic Warfare is easily the map designs and concept of the game itself, heavily reminding of games from years past such as the Army Men Series and Toy Commander on the SEGA Dreamcast. Plastic Warfare's maps are absolutely fantastic, unique, and a joy to explore, but not only that the game modes that accompany them are just as creative.

Everything from trying to capture your enemies flags on rubber ducks in a bathtub, to lighting more candles than the opposing team for a birthday cake, to as I mentioned earlier trying to thaw out a plastic dinosaur, all while still including classic game modes you'd expect such as capture the flag, but however now in a fish tank, to your classic death match mode but now set up on a game board originally meant for dice rolling and for plastic army men, to plenty more the variety in game modes and maps in this game are fantastic.

The gameplay overall itself is simple enough to pick up and play straight from the start without much of a learning curve to it, I don't expect this game to attempt to become an e-sport or anything but the gameplay itself is effective, each weapon you're equipped with all have their uses and right times to utilize them, none of them I thought felt over powered or unbalanced which for a new release title is a pretty good feat to achieve and depending on well your team works together you can easily dominate the match if the other team is just focused on thinking it's nothing but a death match mode.

Now graphically Plastic Warfare looks absolutely fantastic, running on the Unreal 4 Engine the texture work and environments across the 10 maps look great, not to mention all while running extremely smooth even on a mid-tier computer like mine.

The environments are bright and colorful as well with tons of attention to detail and great ideas for the map designs, the character models of the army men stand out enough to spot and shoot them as well and the animations are passable, but over all the game simply looks and runs great.

The soundtrack as well is pretty decent, each map has it's own specific theme, most of which are pretty decent, but I personally hated the birthday cake map's soundtrack after about 30 seconds of hearing it. But over all the soundtrack pretty great.

But now let's discuss...

THE BAD
-Matchmaking is a bit of pain and connection issues
-5 vs 5 Is a bit lacking and I feel some maps could have increased the player count
-Texture pop-in and other minor graphical issues

During my 3 to 4 hours or so I spent with The Mean Greens probably my biggest issue with it, is simply the matchmaking was a bit of a pain, not to mention a few connection issues.

Trying to actually FIND a game for me personally at times was a bit of a mess, probably because it was the weekend, I'm not sure, but I had a number of host was lost connecting issues and was booted back to the main menu more times than I can count after failing to connect, so then I had to go back into the server list again and wait some more while it refreshed again which became a tad bit annoying.

Then throw in match making issues and trying to actually play with my friend, it just added to the annoyance of it all, once we were connected together, the game had trouble even finding any matches for us once we got the party system going, which more or less forced us to simply create our own lobby and server and wait on other players instead.

But honestly that's probably one of the only major complaints I have with this game and I'm sure it'll be fixed with future updates or at least here's hoping as this is a game I could easily see myself playing some more of in the future.
My next issue, much more minor and opinionated, I felt some of the maps could have benefited with a higher player count than 5 vs 5, as there were times I had a hard time even finding people on some of the larger more death match focused maps such as the Art Table map, but I'm sure with modding from the community and future updates this will also change.

Graphically I only had the odd stutter or weird frame rate inconsistency here and there, but that's more than likely due to my mid-tier computer set up at the moment. However I noticed despite running on max settings the game still did suffer from some minor pop in issues here and there when the maps first loaded in.

But now it's time I give...


THE OPINION

Now if you're like me and you stumbled onto this on the front page of Steam, it probably caught your eye, it sure did for me and I can definitely recommend this to anyone who maybe interested, the gameplay is fast paced, simple yet effective, and fun.

The maps and game modes are gorgeous looking and unique and if you've got some friends looking for a game to play over the next weekend or two this wouldn't be a bad choice and for only $10 it's fair on the price.
I had a ton of fun during my roughly 4 hours with it and couldn't recommend it enough, hopefully the match making gets improved with future patches, I can definitely see myself playing this more in the future.


If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: Follow Original Curator Group

reviewText: An awesome game which brings out your inner child and fond memories of the old Army Men games and imagination you once possessed as a young lad playing with toys. All maps are very enjoyable with each having it's own game mode, music and home inspired ambiance much like the atmospheres you'd create as a child out of ordinary household items for a proper setup for your toys to have an all out battle. With the maps offering variety there is not much favoritism towards any specific maps which means players do not vote for the same map or two over and over endlessly like players in other games tend to make a habit. There's a pretty cool freezer map and a pretty sweet cake map as well! If you enjoy fast paced third person shooters I urge you to get this game! The gameplay itself is reasonably basic which I have been really enjoying. Everyone is equal from the start due to the game not having any ranks, upgrades or perks which in my opinion is marvelous since that means you have to rely on skill, tactics and hustle rather than having an unfair advantage on less fortunate players. As I said, everyone is equal as soon as they play the game, so as long as you're a decent shooter you should be able to do just fine! The community has been very kind so far as I have yet to run into any rude or arrogant players, so no need to worry about immature elitists and enjoy yourself! This has quickly become one of my favorite games due to it's competitive gameplay and yet silly charm, I highly recommend this game!

reviewText:
Awesome TPS reminiscent of the old Army Men games. Design and stage aesthetics are incredible, gameplay...less so. Not that it's particularly bad, it just doesn't live up to the inspired art direction. Maps feel large and varied, but most are linear without forwarding spawn points, which leads to a lot of stalemates on objective-based maps.

For me, the clear passion and inspiration that went into the stages and throwback gameplay were worth the price of admission. There are no loadouts, classes, or levelling systems. Just dead-simple, fun Green vs. Tan gameplay.

As an addendum, developers are set to add at least 10 (!!!) more maps, along with gameplay tweaking as time goes on. I still think it's worth the asking price but, if you're looking for more, they're apparently looking to deliver.

reviewText:
A fun and light-hearted shooter, worth every penny. The maps are well designed with a gamemode in mind, so there's no problem trying to adapt gamemodes to different maps where they may (or may not) work. The visual design is amazing and the skyboxes definitely make the illusion of being a toy soldier. Not to mention the soundtrack is AMAZING (its on iTunes). 10/10 would buy again!

Pro/Con List:

Pros:
-Great visual desgin
-Fun gamemodes
-Classes are balanced
-unique maps/gamemodes
-FANTASTIC Soundtrack

Cons:
-Only 10(ish) maps
-Kitchen Run can be a clusterf**k
-Servers can be empty at times

Overall, I highly recommend this game!

tl;dr: Get it.

reviewText:
Plastic soldiers you say? Well, why not, it's not like this is the first time game used those. Suddenly an onslaught of soldiers looks kind of cute, instead of severed limbs you get shattered plastic and there is no blood. So apart from the theme, what is this all about? The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare is a multiplayer third person shooter in which two sides of plastic soldiers, greens and tans, fight on a variety of über cute maps with their plastic arsenal.

Each side can have five soldiers at most and while you cannot pick different types of little warriors, you can pick from a variety of weapons to use. Each soldier carries an M4, sniper riflle, shotgun, rocket launcher and flamethrower from which you can choose on the go. Have you used all your sniper rifle ammo? No problem, take out your shot gun and run around for a moment while your ammo gets automatically replenished, that is if you live long enough. I would say that neither of these weapons is weaker than others maybe apart from rocket launcher; which however can fire just one rocket before having to replenish ammo. The gun handling itself is far from being unique as it is very arcade like, fitting with the theme of the game I would say. If you are a fan of realism... well, you would not be even reading this review so whatever.

Soldiers can duke it out on an astounding number of 10 maps (hi SW) each equipped with a different mode ranging from typical deatch match and capture the flag to candle lighting on a birthday party. The theme of the game let the devs to come up with some really unique arenas for the soldiers to fight in which is in my opinion the biggest perk of the game. Who would not enjoy a ride on a toy train around a christmas tree or an onslaught inside a Foosball. When you are riding a little gummy duck inside a bathtub you won't even care that the graphics are not exactly perfect and some textures could use a little more work which brings me to the next part of this review, graphics.

As I have said, the game is not the bestest" looker on the market
date: devs of The Mean Greens tried to bring us a fully 3D experience and as many small indie studios kinda struggle with the delivery; However for what it is
recommended: the game is pleasant to look at. It is very colorful and one will forgive it the sometimes too rough edges and blurry textures. From a technical standpoint the game runs fine and I did not notice any major hiccups on an upper mid-end desktop. In settings there are plenty of options to fiddle with while trying to get a better performance from a lower end machine.\n\nAll in all
hoursPlayed: The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare is a pretty decent game which cannot
voteText: and in my opinuon should not
helpfulPercent: compete with the popular shooters like CS:GO or Overwatch; However in itself can bring a lot of joy if you are a fan of arcade shooting in an unique arenas while listening to a pretty neat soundtrack. The main question will be whether it can keep the servers running and populated and for how long. So should you buy it? For 10 bucks it is not a bad deal whether you are bored of competitive shooters and want to relax or want a not so brutal game for your young ones so feel free to grab it

reviewText:
This game looks incredible! All the visuals are so good and the aesthetic and all the looks about it are just perfect! The gameplay... it could use some fixin' up.

Although the game looks stunning when you actually play it you notice quite a few issues with it, here are the ones I have found so far:

40% of the time when someone shoots you there is no way of telling you have been shot, your health goes down but there is no red semi circle or even sound effect. The circle appears sometimes and I can't even tell if there is a sound effect for being shot.
The flamethrowers are way way too op. Maybe they're supposed to be a replacement for the knife but at close range they can kill you in less than half a second before you even have time to react, the gamemodes where its hard to be a flamethrowing ♥♥♥♥♥ are the best.
EXAMPLE: I was playing a CTF and on the other team there was a guy who kept using a flamethrower, by the end of the game no one even got to their flag as flamethrowers were camping there and our team managed to kill off the 2 people that actually tried to get our flag. The end results show the flamethrower guy had 32 kills 2 deaths and his other team members combined had about 7 kills (three other people). Our team of also four people had combined kills of about 20 or less. FIX THE FLAMETHROWERS PLEASE
I don't know why, maybe its the lag in the servers or maybe I'm just really crap at this game but I have played a lot of other deathmatch games such as GTA V and I do often get MVP so I know what aiming is. Whenever I aim and shoot at someone it's a 50/50 chance of actually having my bullets land.
Last of all I just want to say that the last time I played this game there were about 4 flamethrower guys in my server and I just got so fed up of jumping server to server just to find some honest people who actually use real guns that don't have infinite ammo :l and therefore I don't even want to play this game anymore until they do something about it.

I'm not crying about being a n00b, I'm just pointing out an easy exploit that ruins the spirit of the game for me. I will upvote this game but only because I do actually like the game; 40% of the players? Not so much.

reviewText:
I'm a beta tester for The Mean Greens (this includes testing future content), if that matters at all.

I'm a person who doesn't really like shooters at all. There were a few exceptions for me (Halo 2, Army Men: Sarge's Heroes 1 and 2), but I couldn't get into any of them. The Mean Greens, however, tapped into the part of me that remembers the aforementioned 3D0 Army Men Sarge's Heroes games [and just to be clear, I played the PlayStation versions of those games; I hated the N64 versions...), and reminded me that these games don't have to be all doom-and-gloom, ultra-realistic, or boring and gritty-looking.

Aesthetically, the game looks gorgeous, running at a full 1080p 60FPS [when on max settings]. The environments are just like the ones you'd find 2-inch tall plastic toys playing in. The kitchen, a bathtub, a living room, a table, a fish tank, a refridgerator... it's all here and accounted for. They're all full of wackiness and creativity, and I loved every single map.

Gameplay-wise, it reminded me so much of (you know the games by now). There's new stuff like sprinting, an admittedly better aiming system (simply hold down the right mouse button), and it controls very, very nicely. I was playing with both a controller (a PS4/DualShock 4 controller) and a mouse and a keyboard. While I personally prefer the latter, using a controller, at least a DS4 one, feels very natural for this game, and it works as well as any other shooter.

The online itself was fun, fast and frantic. The maps are small (or, um, a little smaller than big? Not that small but still big? How to word this... but they're by no means super small or compact) but that doesn't make them any less fun. Plus, in each map, there's a different objective. In one map, you have your average slayer"
recommended: you'll be having to thaw out a dinosaur frozen in ice (using a flamethrower) before your opposing team thaws theirs first. Every map doesn't have the same mode
hoursPlayed: which is really refreshing for a genre like this. The different modes were all fun to play and I didn't really have complaints with any of them.\n\nBut at this point this may all seem like blind praise
voteText: but these are the words I'm sticking to. Obviously
helpfulPercent: I may have a small nostalgic bias because of how much this game reminded me of my beloved Sarge's Heroes games
votesHelpful: but nevertheless
votesTotal: The Mean Greens delivers in all aspects of fun
column16: and everything it's trying to achieve.\n\nI had an awesome time playing the game and I hope a lot of other people will
column18: just go play it. This really isn't something you want to miss out on."

reviewText:
The Mean Greens – Plastic Warfare:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I guess most of us (boys) used to play with Green and Tan soldiers in our early youth! Re-creating the battle of the kitchen or the most infamous battle of the bathtub where an entire division drowns to death in your human mucky water!  But now, you can do these battles on your PC, isn’t exciting…? Well it is absolutely MARVELLOUS!!!

The Mean Greens – Plastic Warfare is a third person online multiplayer shooter game where you play either a Green or a Tan toy soldier in 10 unique and well-designed maps. You will play the “Barnyard Ball” map (one of my favourites) where you not only have to eliminate as many soldiers as possible but score up to 3 goals to win the game; or the “Kitchen Run’ map where you have to push the enemy cup over the benchtop to win the round!

Your soldier will have a number of weapons at his disposal, 5 in total: machine guns, shotgun, sniper rifle, flame thrower and the all mighty bazooka to teach one or two tricks to your enemies. I thoroughly enjoy hiding behind the sponge waiting for a figurine to pass by and greet him with a small missile (rocket) to blow him out of the kitchen! FUN…! FUN…! FUN…!

Controls are really easy to use; you run, jump, crouch, roll and of course shoot at plastic figurines. The game runs very well and you will be treated with a great soundtrack. The graphics are wonderful and the game is a great price!

Plenty of dedicated servers to play on, including some Australian ones!

Positives:
~~~~~~~~

-	Fun and addictive
-	10 unique maps and modes
-	Dedicates servers
-	Great Graphics and Soundtracks
-	Great price
-	Achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~

-	None!!

The Mean Greens – Plastic Warfare is truly the surprise game of this year for me!

10/10 +10% for good measure!

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

reviewText:
The Mean Greens is a solid concept that turned into a half-baked game.

The music and environments give the game a polished veneer but the underlying gameplay is stale.    Fast movement speed combined with rudimentary physics and ♥♥♥♥-poor hit detection makes the gun battles schizophrenic and unsatisfying.  If you still want to give it a try, good luck finding a single populated server.  As of this writing, there are usually fewer than ten people playing globally at any given time.

Another promising multiplayer FPS that fails to deliver.  Don't waste your money.

reviewText:
This game is great fun to play with friends.

Sometimes the server browser can be a bit annoying, and matchmaking will sometimes connect you to full servers, but this game runs amazingly with no issues.

Great, well optimized graphics-- reminds me of those custom Call of Duty 2 maps and the old Army Men games from my youth.

Gunplay is fairly balanced, but switching between weapons is not convenient or easy at all, even on a controller. Some guys just RPG and grenade spam but that's okay.

Maps are very well designed, even if the game is only 5v5. Would prefer a larger player count for some of the maps, even if by 1-3 players added per team.

Soundtrack is amazing.

This game is well constructed and there are tons of easter eggs that 1990s kids will love. So much humor in this game, too. The win/lose screens have me rolling every time.

I would absolutely recommend this game, it's cheap, and it's incredibly fun to play! With some minor refinements it could be a real winner.

9/10

reviewText:
This game looks and plays amazing. You play as toy soldiers in a toy universe, and thanks to the Unreal 4 game engine, it all looks so very smooth appealing to the eye. It's just absolute eye candy as you can see in the screenshots. Game modes are very varied, extremely fun and everything is really well balanced. Teamwork is also important, and it makes the modes even more fun!

One of the best things about this game is the developer support. The devs TRULY care about their players. At first I thought the Steam community was overreacting. But here's a little story: I was playing a game, and a player named 'MeanGreenDev' was playing as well. Turns out it was a real developer. We talked to him in the lobbies and he said 'Rockets are being patched tomorrow, you have my word'. A day later, indeed a patch was released, containing Rocket fixes. Never have I seen something like this before. If you don't believe me: check the screenshot I made, and look up the 12/15/2015 game update. The dev was happy to hear feedback in the lobby and asked us to leave a review. Well here it is, Ashton! Shoutout to Ashton Andersen, the dev guy who played with us that day!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=575434356

reviewText:
This game is an odd one. Charming yet flawed.

*IMPORTANT NOTE*: Steam chats dont work with this game as of now the game uses the mic without actually using it making you unable to talk in any steam chatrooms.

As someone who has played the old Army Men games such as Sarges Heroes 1 & 2 I can recommend this title to anyone who enjoyed those even a little, as its essentially a multiplayer only version of those with far superior controls. (nostalgia goggles will never hide the horrible controls of the army men series)

It has 10 maps each with their own game mode and gimmicks which makes it quite a refreshing title to play for an hour or so. However the map Off The Rails" is not quite well optimized and is the only map my PC struggles with. (which is quite low spec I will admit)

Besides "Off The Rails" the only other map that gave me trouble was "Barnball" this map is focused on a Table Football field where the objective is to score goals by rolling the ball into the enemy barn. while that sounds great in theory it rarely works out and usually devolves into team deathmatch/ a spawncamp scenario and gets boring rather quickly.

It has all the weapons you would expect in a game about the green and tan base-bound warriors: Assault rifle
hoursPlayed: Bazooka and a Flamethrower.\n\nWhile fun to use they come across as inconsistent
voteText: especially the flamethrower which can go from instakilling to taking several seconds to kill
helpfulPercent:
combine this with the fact that the flames dont actually show what you are hitting its not very comfortable to use. This does not hurt the game much however as its main purpose is to complete objectives eg. melting ice and lighting candles.

The game is quite fast paced with a very low time to kill on all the weapons and short respawn times. this usually works in its favour until teams become unbalanced resulting in a near endless massacre of one side until the round timer runs out. (especially on more open maps where snipers dominate.)

All in all  its great value for its price but the devs are going to have to put some work in to iron out some of the issues. but compared to most indie multiplayer titles at this price its one of the best."

reviewText:
Pros
+ The maps all look nice and are asthetically pleasing
+ The scale of the maps are impressive; you really feel like a toy soldier in a huge room
+ The weapons are balanced pretty well (apart from the rocket launcher being pretty OP)
+ The gamemodes are very creative and fun (although some are not obvious what the objective is at first)

Cons
- A few connectivity issues; sometimes hard to join a server (have to keep trying before it lets you in)
- The rocket launcher is a bit OP and, despite only having 1 shot, is usually the most-used weapon
- A few maps make the matches feel either too rushed or too drawn out
- Can't shoot while jumping, which is forgettable sometimes but annoying other times (like on maps with jump pads)

Overall the gameplay is very simple but fun, with easy to understand mechanics. This game has a lot of potential and I hope that it succeeds so that we can see more updates in the future, such as more maps, gamemodes, and vehicles.

reviewText:
A highly enjoyable, casual multiplayer shooter with a fun and lighthearted style that endears itself to me.

The Mean Greens is a 5v5 multiplayer shooter which sees the two teams, the Greens and the Tans, square off in one of many different and surprisingly unique gamemodes. What makes it stand out is the fact that you play as those cheap little plastic toy soldiers that you would see being sold at the dollar store, and the maps take place in all sorts of everyday household locations, ranging from the inside of a freezer to an arts and crafts table even up to a large saltwater fish tank.

The gameplay is simple enough. You've got your standard 2 teams, an objective and the undeniable sense that you should just go over there and shoot their plastic nuts off. There are no classes or character progression systems, each and every player has the same loadout as you do at all times, meaning there are no picks and counter-picks, just an evenly matched lineup in which the best team wins.
Although, there are some cheap-shot handholding weapons like the rocket launcher which in essense is a one-shot one-kill weapon. But it's relatively balanced since there are no ammo pickups on the maps, and once you shoot the rocket launcher it will go on cooldown for a ridiculously long time before you can use it again. In fact it is quicker to just die and respawn to get the rocket launcher back. Many will think the rocket launcher to be a cheap weapon, and they'd be right, but its use does require some thought and timing, since you cannot instantly pull it out and fire away, instead you have to wait for a moment for your character to get it ready, giving enemies ample time to shoot you down or close the distance so you cannot kill them without killing yourself. The cheapshot weapons like this may seem like they could ruin the game and cause the most skilled players to get constantly wrecked by the biggest shooter virgin alive. But it actually doesn't ruin anything, since you also have the same weapons as they do, making this in my opinion a very casual multiplayer game.
(As of patch 1.4, the rocket launcher cooldown is now spread out between lives, meaning you can no longer die and have it ready to go after an 8 second respawn time instead of waiting a minute or so to have it back)

The gamemodes and maps are fun and visually interesting in their designs, bright colors and massive backdrops create some outstanding environments that aren't too distracting from the gameplay itself. You've got your standard multiplayer maps like King of the Hill, Capture the Flag and Free-For-All, but also some unique gamemodes that takes full advantage of the fact that you're playing small toy soldiers in a big world. Like the birthday cake map where the objective is for one team to use their flamethrowers to light as many candles as they can before time runs out, while the other team has to defend the cake, switching at the end of a round, with whatever team having the most candles lit wins.

Does it have its flaws? Yeah... The third person perspective I feel doesn't really do the game many favors, it's difficult to see which weapon you're holding in the middle of an engagement, for example the M-16 and the sniper rifle, since they lack a distinctive silhouette when your soldier is holding them. Also, because of the third-person view the most important HUD elements are subdued, being difficult to notice when you're in the middle of a firefight. How much ammo is in your currently selected weapon or how much health you have doesn't show all too well in the middle of gameplay.

I feel like this game would benefit so much more if you were allowed to at least toggle between first and third-person views, like you could in Tribes: Ascend, and I really think the HUD needs an overhaul. But all things considered, it's nothing that completely ruins anything, because like I said, it's casual multiplayer. If you're looking for some simple, easy to pick up and play multiplayer fun with an interesting design twist, then the Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare is right up your alley.

reviewText: I rarely ever review games on here but this one I feel needs to be rated! Every map feels unique because they are associated for specific game modes which makes each match feel special. reviewText:
Super fun (super cheap) 3rd person shooter. It looks great, controls well, the maps and modes are fantastic (except the train, ♥♥♥♥ that train.) Not to mention the graphics, which are bright, colorful, and crisp. The models and textures are fantastic game-wide.

It runs like a dream, but 144Hz users beware: enable Vsync or it'll invariably crash every single match. I dunno what this game's problem is with running at HFR, but there it is. Options menu is a little eh, but it's an indie that just got released so I'll let it slide. Full mouse controls in-menu is pretty nice.

Network-side, it gets a bit ugly, but when you stabily connect to a server, there's nothing like it. The community isn't bad (yet,) so there are a ton of nice people in chat who just want to help make the game better and discover all its little quirks.

Right now, it's $10. I would buy it for $15 in a heartbeat.

reviewText:
Along with the great graphics and novel, innovative, and immersive level design, the game sports very nice Audio too. Good clean directional sound and VERY good thematic scores as well.

They just need to simply tighten up the UE4 character movements/animations a little bit (not exactly necessary, but more for perceived aesthetic/style), and perhaps grind some of those game modes out and you have a nice lil' enjoyable TPS package right here folks, all for a comparable small price.

I can easily run everything on max with no hitch even on a GTX650, nice n' smooth, and all options/controls are complete, customizable. Game is stable, lots of servers, you can tell the quality production. Nice job to the devs here on creating their own distinct world.

Not sure if the 5v5 is the max (it seems like it is), or if it was just some of the rooms I was in, but, yeah, these maps easily could still accommodate more for sure: 8v8, 10v10 at max even, perfect.

reviewText:
This game was a worthy buy and a lot of fun, something you'll probably play for a few hours every now and again. Definitely worth getting your friends to play in a group.

The primary issue with the game is the level design, which I don't think has been playtested very thoroughly. A huge portion of the games I've played so far all end in Stalemate because there just aren't allow enough options to make a move - and in some cases, the long match time combined with stalemate just makes it feel like it's dragging a bit. I feel as though aesthetics have been favoured over design a little bit here, but the maps are nice to look at.

Also, the 'Quick Play' option is yet to find a session that isn't full, but the servers are good and there are quite a few players atm. Also noticed a lot of UE4 Marketplace / Example content here - but if anything this is a testament to how good that content is. Had a lot of fun playing it so far, and would like to see additional content!
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
The Mean Greens is a nostalgic and briliantly crafted shooter. This is how you imagined your little plastic army men battling it out when you were a kid.

Pros:

Each map has such attention to detail that it shames AAA shooters of today. Maps like Art Table look like somone took time in laying out each map piece, unlike the boringly similar maps we see all too often. The game also looks very good, graphically. It's running on the Unreal 4 engine, so it's certainly no slouch in the technical deparment. The lighting is great, physics are fantastic, and the models are all very well made.

The development team is very active. They frequently ask for player feedback and I have seen various Devs interacting with the community on Twitch. This game is 100% a passion project, and the Devs are clearly devoted to delivering a quality experience to its players.

Cons:

This game is still in developement, so it is far from perfect. As of right now there are several glitches to be fixed and various tweaks to be made. Notably, the match making and conectivity is a bit wonky, hit detection is bad and surely needs a revamp. Also I would not say this game is very well optimized, I have seen plenty of random fps drops even on high end rigs. However, all of these issues can certainly be fixed and I have no doubt the Dev Team is hard at work.

Additional Thoughts: This game is very refreshing, I have not played such a fun and unique online shooter since the first time I played the Ratchet and Clank series. Nor have I ever met such a passionate Dev Team, these guys really want this to be the best game it possible can. No DLC or f2p gimmicks, the Devs actually want you to have a fun time instead of the shady tactics we've seen from AAA companies lately.
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
What do you get when you cross fun with Army men toys? This game, The Mean Greens!

Thanks to a close friend of mine, this game is now on my nightly play list. To think such a simple concept could present amazing hours of entertainment and laughs. I'll go over my personal pros and cons of this game and hope it helps you decide on what's best for you.

Graphics:- Don't like the colors fool you, everything in this game is done for a reason and it shows. The models look great, very much on the level of the army men in Toy Story, these soldiers run, jump and roll like you would expect them to.  The level designs are very original and immersive, you truly feel like a small toy inside a large world.

Sound:- WOW, just wow, if there is anything that you should take the time to appreciate is the sound.  The BG is just fitting for all stages that you play on, from the Christmas jingle on the railway to the swinging tunes that pump you up as you race across the table to push a giant cup, yes a giant cup.  If that weren't enough, on the birthday cake level, attacking sides are greeted to a jazz attack the cake" verse while defenders hold the line with "defend the cake." Its those little details that really make you smile as you play along with the ecosystem of the game.

Gameplay:- When it comes movement and gun play
date: the game holds strong. A simple enough scheme
hoursPlayed: its one of those where its easy to play
voteText: not too hard to master. Within a few rounds you should have a great feel for all the weapons and know when to use each weapon for the situation at hand.\n\nReplay:- Loads of it
helpfulPercent: as the outcome of each match can be very different.  From capture the flag
votesHelpful: to lighting candles on a cake
votesTotal: to scoring a goal on a large Foosball table
votesFunny: there's a ton to do and experience in this addicting game.\n\nCons:- People complaining the game has no future. The game has only been out a week
commentsCount: but i can tell you that this game is here to stay. I've had the honor of having a dev or two in my channel asking for feedback
column16: that alone shows that they care about their game and wish for it to be enjoyed by all.\n\nIn the end
column17: you should really play this one and see for yourself if you like it or not. I do feel that this a fantastic game for the price they are asking. The devs care and are listening as they too want to make sure that you're getting the best bang for your buck!\n\nCheers"

reviewText:
I would definitely reccomend this game to anyone, especially since it's on sale at the moment. It's an amazing 3rd person shooter with all the qualities of a competitive shooter but the relaxed atmosphere of a more casual game.

PROS:

- Great music!
- 10 maps, each with its own game mode.
- 5 players per team (the magic numebr given the size of the maps)
- Immersive and beautiful graphics
- A silly and fun feel reminicent of TF2
- A variety of balanced weapons to choose from

CONS (many of these are likely to change, as the game is very new):

- Hard to connect to a server without being disconnected, and hard to find a server close to me (US west)
- No shooting while in the air
- Scoreboard seems very vague - it's hard for me to tell how much I'm really helping the team
- Not a whole lot of emphasis on teamwork (there should be in an objective based game)


Overall great game, worth the money.

reviewText:
Loads of my complaints have already been patched out of this game since I first gave this review.

Now it's worth every penny as we're talking a simple little indie game here running on the nostalgia of classic Army man games that offers more gamemodes and maps then triple A games like the recent star wars battlefront!

The cap is no longer 5v5 at the request of the community and has been raised based on preference, though dedicated servers I believe only go up to a max of 10v10.

Weapons have recieved a good bit of balancing now with the dreaded rocket launcher only shaving off 90 hps instead of a punishing instant death.

If I could give this games cons it's that the ping recently has shot through the roof and this can effect the frames of a few games.

But with the swiftness of the devoloper's willingness to adjust and fix the game to appeal to its fast growing fanbase, there's a bright future in a world of constant plastic warfare!

reviewText: This game is really fun but, not fantastic. The idea of you being a toy soldier and fighting in combat is amazing idea and I give props to the developers for doing that idea. The game looks really good with amazing shadows and bright colorful visuals and it shows what the Unreal 4 engine can do. The maps make you feel like your toy soldier. From controlling the points on a toy train going around a christmas tree, to you fighting on a giant birthday cake and your trying to light the candles to win. The issue with this game is that it doesn't really add nothing new to the gameplay. It feels generic like i'm playing Gears of War but, it's still fun with it's creative idea and style. Ever since I got this game, I've been coming back and playing more with my friends. So yeah, if want to feel like your in Toy Story, I would get this for sure.

reviewText:
A very fun game. The level designs are very creative and lovingly crafted, with each having its own game-mode attached to it. This ensures that you're able to play something different every round, whether that's free for all, capture the flag, or the many bespoke game types such as table-football.

Weapon balance is cleverly done, in that everyone has an assault rifle, a sniper rifle, a shotgun, a bazooka and a flamethrower. These weapons have limited ammo and are renewed after a long period of time - this makes the game harder the longer you survive as you gradually run out of tools at your disposal, which helps level the playing field.

Character movement is very fluid, and the closest comparison would be Pandemic's Battlefront games. The use of Unreal Engine 4 makes the game very scalable for different systems - I'm playing on a 7 year old PC on low settings and it runs fine, however you'll be able to attain impressive visuals and gorgeous art design on higher end systems.

An excellent low-cost title, which provides a lot of scope for future content.

reviewText: The Mean Greens takes you back to your childhood in a way you could only imagine it. You play as Plastic Toy Soldiers on maps created with household items just as a child might put together for their Army Men Toys. The gameplay is flowing, fast, and very fun, with many creative maps and game modes to play on, there is Capture the Flag to Light the most Candles on a birthday cake with your flamethrower. Graphics are great and the feel of the game is just as amazing.\n\nEDIT: The only real problem with this game is that no one plays it anymore. It actually makes me sad that such a simple, yet masterpiece of a game died off so quickly.

reviewText:
The first time I launched this, what was selected and where the game showed my cursor were half a screen apart, and when I went into options, the game hung and had to have the process canceled.

I forced the app to use the nvidia card instead of being stupid, and it didn't crash. I turned on my steam controller and it picked it right up. Then I found out this game is multiplayer only.

Ok, no problem. Quick find just spun endlessly. Server browser took a few minutes and many trys to find any games with players at all on the entire continent (and only two world wide).

I tried joining a bunch of times and eventually decided that maybe I was being impatient, so I left it to connect on its own time.

I tried joining that game at 47m past 1pm. When I checked my phone to see how long it had been, I wound up playing Siralim waiting for the game to connect. Then I shaved. Now it is 20 minutes past 2pm, more than half an hour later and the game hasn't connected to the server or indeed done anything but spin the wheel.

To answer if I can recommend this game: I got it for free, from a promotional give away, and at that price I would not recommend you bother installing it. For any price above free, I certainly would not recomment.

reviewText:
PRO: fantastic highly detailed visuals, fast, precise, snappy, and responsive movement. a roll key that feels just right and compliments the already strong player movement. creative map design and a visually consistent use of scale.

CONS: the gunplay is floaty and the hit detection is inconsistant, shooting reticule is strangely placed slightly below the center of the screen, some of the modes are poorly thought out for the maps they take place on, theres a general lack of visual audio feedback, lack of HUD options and options in general, and there's not as much content for currently cheaper/free shooters on steam.


The Mean Greens feels like a game that was cut short due to the devs running out of either time or money, that being said theres a strong foundation here that if the devs tweak and build on could be my GOTY. the devs have stated major content updates are on the way and they've already released several major patches in only one week.

However at the moment there are some gripes that need to be looked at, the biggest one is the difficulty in getting into a game that isn't already full or the host disconnects it currently take much longer than it should to find a game and actually connect to it, once you in tho the connection issues disappear.

Another is some maps feel a bit unbalenced or the objective  to difficult to achieve due to the respawn rate and close respawn point of the enemy team. Last point maybe just me but the bazooka is a free kill and needs to some how be balenced. while you only get 1 shot per life and no good way to get ammo it still comes off to strong. A map summery should be available in game to know what we are supposed to do, tho to be honest is doesn't take long to figure it out is just a minor issue.

~~~ TLDR:

Pros:
-Gameplay
-in game music
-Maps are creative and feel new
- devs are attentive, already 4 patches in 1 week to address community concerns

Cons:

-bazooka needs to be a bit more balenced (maybe reduced splash damage)

reviewText:
GeneralYou're an Army Man in 3rd person killing other army men. Team up with friends or go solo (by not teaming via MP) in this action 3rd person shooter. Whether you're Green, Tan or FFA color, you're an army man in a huge world. Basic guns: Assault Rifle, Shotgun, Sniper Rifle, Bazooka and Flamethrower. There's no store, cash, etc - you're stuck with those weapons to kill your enemy.

Good looking maps and graphics for such a simple game. Some maps are small and some are bigger than others. There's different game modes with different objectives to do on different maps.  However, don't expect it to be like MicroVolts.

Cons- Not sure if this is Unreal or how the game was coded or setup: most people are complaining about low fps when in Fullscreen at high resolution - this is a fact (for me at least). For a temporary fix I set my game resolution to 1280x720 and put it in Fullscreen. I get very high fps when I do that opposed to 1600x900 in fullscreen (10-12fps). Yes, I have more than great PC specs to run this game.
- No Ouch!" sounds when you've been shot or being burnt. This is quite annoying because you don't have time to take cover because you don't know you're getting shot at (unless you notice your health going down). No death sounds either.

Rating: 5/10"

reviewText:
Based on the first few screenshots and intro I bought this, reminds me of the old ps1 army men games, or soldiers in toy story!

Ok so the game has only been released this month and does have a few issues, but once in a game it is a really good laugh, spent first hour not being too competitive just having a fun play, the levels are genius and amazingly beautiful with unreal engine!

You play as either the green or tan army's and have different objectives per map, one of my faves takes place in a bathtub trying to capture the flag, jumping on moving bath ducks with a toy octopus, really fun and enjoyable game, recommended I can’t say much more great concept levels and hopefully more content soon.

I installed an ran it fine but took 10 mins for my friend to get past the logo screen, he bought the game after watching me play for a few rounds and liked look of it so much bought it as well. In my opinion well worth picking up while on sale,playing with friends is the icing on the cake.

If anyone is having an issue getting game to get play initially try my friends fix here >

There is an issue where the game would not go past the Logo screen (After the initial logo before it boots up into full screen).

I decided to root around in the games files and found UE4PrereqSetup_x64.exe" located in "\steamapps\common\The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare\Engine\Extras\Redist\en-us"

After manually running this file (Choose the x86 if you are on a 32bit system) and installing it the game worked.
"

reviewText:
Back in my childhood, i played a lot of Army Men titles in Playstation and Playstation 2. This games reminds me of these old good titles, it's the same spirit, but with a good multiplayer, nice graphics, a really good map design and interesting variety of game modes.

At the moment haves a small community, few players play the game, but developers are veri in with the project, they are in the forums solving troubles, and they listen to the community.

And the game it's worth only 10€, if you enjoyed old Army Men titles, you should buy it. Also, you should buy it if you want a title to just enter and have fun, both with friends or to play alone in those moments you don't know what to do, you only know you want instant fast action.

reviewText:
PRO: fantastic highly detailed visuals, fast, precise, snappy, and responsive movement. a roll key that feels just right and compliments the already strong player movement. creative map design and a visually consistent use of scale.

CONS: the gunplay is floaty and the hit detection is inconsistant, shooting reticule is strangely placed slightly below the center of the screen, some of the modes are poorly thought out for the maps they take place on, theres a general lack of visual audio feedback, lack of HUD options and options in general, and there's not as much content for currently cheaper/free shooters on steam.


The Mean Greens feels like a game that was cut short due to the devs running out of either time or money, that being said theres a strong foundation here that if the devs tweak and build on could be my GOTY. the devs have stated major content updates are on the way and they've already released several major patches in only one week.

reviewText:
Played this game for ~2hours, seems really good so far. There's enough players to set up a good server, alot fun guns to use and everyone gets to play their own style.

Graphics are eye-pleasing, abit Toy Story-like, which was a good change from all these reality-looking" fps-games.

Suggestions for future:
Add "classes" so it's easier to pick what weapon you want to be using
Scrollwheel-weaponchange should be instant

reviewText:
Design 10/10
Gameplay 8/10

This game is amazing and a great buy for it's price. It's a nice change of pace from the other shooters. Each map is a different gamemode and really add some really amazing elements to the game. I would have to say that so far Operation Birthday is my favourite map. Teams take turns trying to light the candles on the cake well the other team defends.

Their are a few bugs but nothing gamebreaking. The only thing they need to work on for the gameplay is balancing the weapons (Rockets are really op, even with the CD) and a bit more survivablity would be nice.

I would 100% recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun TPS
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I do recommend this game for ppl with modern pc's.  User interface, controls (cod,tf like), maps, overall gameplay are Good.
Two things i really like :
1) No step-by-step rpg-style leveling and weapons unlocking
2) 10 maps with 10 game-modes, amazing variety

Two things which i dont like:
1) Very low fps  on lowest settings without antialiasing (10-20 fps on my 3-4 old pc with ATi graphic card)
2) Updating perfomance, taking about 20-30 min to apply 150 mb update
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Ok, I do not usually right reviews but this one wade me, because its pure brilliance.

So action packed, creative, and fun. The physics are perfect and the community seems ok. This just makes me want to watch Toy Story all over again. The sountrack adds to the fun emotion and the level design is fantastic, meaning players have to try new play styles and strategies before going in.  As i said with each map comes a new objective; for example the Art Craft table is Free-For-All, and Bathtub Bash is Capture The Flag. This means players can have a different experience every 5 minutes! Expect my hours rising; and my friends. A simple lobby system can let you easily hop in a game with your mates, and find new mates. The graphics are also astonishing for a 10 dollar game, but thats just the magic we know as Unreal Engine 4; Good choice Devs!

The only downsides ot this game, and things i would definately suggest are:

Shooting while jumping should be put in. adds more action and an overall better time.

Don't remve the rocket launcher, just tune the damage down a little bit, maybe similar to tf2?

Make the main rifle do a little bit more damage here and there, but not to the extent that it is COD, this would just make firefights a little less awkward,

Thats really just those little things I can find wrong.

Thanks for such an oustanding and fun game, im going to let all my friends know! :D

-Cheers for making my mornings and afternoons alot better, Dusky :D

reviewText: Excellent entry into the shooter genre for the pc. While it does have it's quirks namely an odd balance of weapons and a unfathomable level of platforming for a shooter it does prove to be a throughly enjoyable experence. My favorite part and what I think will be yours as well is the level design now, granted it does take some getting used to, the playing of the maps is a bit off at first. The level design of Mean Greens is some of the most refreshing and creative maps I've played in recent memory. Now onto the weapon balance the lifeblood of any shooter the gunplay is moderately-paced though in most senarios you'll be spamming rockets (rocket spam is unreal in this game) besides rockets you'll need your flamethrower to complete objectives but otherwise I never use the other weapons. Overall this is a lovely entry level shooter and a great addition to any gamers library.

reviewText:
What can I say that hasn't been said, this game is a great way to jump into nostalgia mode and go all out, I found myself having a blast the moment I started, yes my hours are insignificant at this time but I can safely say that it's worth the money, I picked it up on sale for me and a few friends and I don't regret it one bit,

The Big Cons that stand out like anyone else has pointed out is the hit detection is just a bit wonky and the whole not shooting while jumping part but those are easily overlooked as the gamemodes are just so varried it's hard not to have fun with this.

Considering most games these days lack basic content at launch, this game packs a ton of it, I can see after a few updates over time this will go down as a great classic.

reviewText:
Ok so, I got this game for myself and my girlfriend. I played the old army man games way back when and was really exited, she just thought it looked fun. So, this is how the experiance went:

-Load in
-Everything is really simple and easy to figure out
-Get into a party with girlfriend
-Search for a game
-Still searching
-Still searching
-Find a Free for all game
-Game is really fun and enjoying game
-Map changes to team game
-1 person on other team is either ungodly good or has hacks and 1 shots everyone on our team
-That 1 person sits by our spawn and racks up over 60 kills in a short game
-That 1 person acts like a ♥♥♥♥ in lobby
-Still searching for new lobby

Conclusion: Fun game at first, some annoying things (cant shoot in air), community is tiny and there are a good bit of ♥♥♥♥♥. It's fun but im kinda regreting the 20$ (10$ for each game). Its something I feel should be free and have some sort of ingame store. Needs a campaign or something more to make it worth. Will still recommend for the nastalgia though.

reviewText: A very fun game with a good variety of game modes and maps. It has a problem with connecting to lobbies now and again, but I expect that to be ironed out soon.  Great graphics, a fun soundtrack, and a decent/friendly community so far.\n\nAs for what I think could be improved, I feel that damage could be emphasized a bit, in that I get a red reticle to let me know I've been damaged, but it would be nice if my character reacted to it. Also it would be nice to be able to jump and shoot at the same time. There's nothing more frustrating than an enemy clay pigeon shooting you while you can't do anything.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is so good, and it also has so much potential for the future.

Nothing about it as it stands is really bad, and compared to other selections in the genre it's fully competitive in it's own right as currently presented. That isn't to say it could just stand a few more features, like a better server browser and search, better party formation outside of just creating your own server, and some neccesary bugfixes. However, these small criticisms aside, the game's really very fun. The gameplay is solid, the community is already rolling pretty well, and gameplay balance is pretty much established. From a graphical and technical perspective UE4 is gorgeous (still the best AO of any engine, imo) performant, and remains my favorite modern engine, crytek and it's perpetual z-fighting be damned.

I do wish you could fire while in the air, for balance perhaps with diminished accuracy (or maybe you can and it just freqently won't let me), and the game stealing the mic and forcing a team-only p2t is a bit annoying. It would be nice to have an option to not lock the mic so I can keep a call going with friends in Steam. Server browsing as a group is pretty frustrating as well since partying up only really allows you to form your own server.

Even with the above notes, this game is certainly worth purchasing and playing, just from a cost to entertainment value perspective. It's as good to better than all the other modern 3rd person multiplayer AAA shooters that keep getting pumped out like Scream sequels, and it costs 1/5th as much. Plus you get the gratification of not contributing to EA or Ubisoft's slow strangling death of multiplayer gaming. With these facts in mind, how can that purchase decision even be a question?

So long as they keep out microtransactions and unlockable crap, I can see myself playing this for a while. Shame on those who, in other reviews, have suggested that sort of thing. Keep the cancer of modern gaming out of this, it's too good to die that way.

reviewText:
PRO: fantastic highly detailed visuals, fast, precise, snappy, and responsive movement. a roll key that feels just right and compliments the already strong player movement. creative map design and a visually consistent use of scale.

CONS: the gunplay is floaty and the hit detection is inconsistant, shooting reticule is strangely placed slightly below the center of the screen, some of the modes are poorly thought out for the maps they take place on, theres a general lack of visual audio feedback, lack of HUD options and options in general, and there's not as much content for currently cheaper/free shooters on steam.


The Mean Greens feels like a game that was cut short due to the devs running out of either time or money, that being said theres a strong foundation here that if the devs tweak and build on could be my GOTY. the devs have stated major content updates are on the way and they've already released several major patches in only one week.

reviewText:
GeneralYou're an Army Man in 3rd person killing other army men. Team up with friends or go solo (by not teaming via MP) in this action 3rd person shooter. Whether you're Green, Tan or FFA color, you're an army man in a huge world. Basic guns: Assault Rifle, Shotgun, Sniper Rifle, Bazooka and Flamethrower. There's no store, cash, etc - you're stuck with those weapons to kill your enemy.

Good looking maps and graphics for such a simple game. Some maps are small and some are bigger than others. There's different game modes with different objectives to do on different maps.  However, don't expect it to be like MicroVolts.

Cons- Not sure if this is Unreal or how the game was coded or setup: most people are complaining about low fps when in Fullscreen at high resolution - this is a fact (for me at least). For a temporary fix I set my game resolution to 1280x720 and put it in Fullscreen. I get very high fps when I do that opposed to 1600x900 in fullscreen (10-12fps). Yes, I have more than great PC specs to run this game.
- No Ouch!" sounds when you've been shot or being burnt. This is quite annoying because you don't have time to take cover because you don't know you're getting shot at (unless you notice your health going down). No death sounds either.

Rating: 5/10"

reviewText:
So my buddy gifted me this game after watching about 10 minutes of a stream we decided we had to check it out since it's only $15, looks fun and gritty. I've only played for 55 minutes but I really enjoy The Mean Greens. It's fast and action packed, has tons and tons of maps (many of which I have yet to play) and lots of great gametypes. Has a nostalgic yet new feel to it. I absolutely love it. Kinda reminds me of Toy Story.

I know this game has only been out for a week but I can tell it's going places. I'll be playing it casually over the winter to see where this game progresses.

12/10 would spend $15 on it again.

reviewText:

-Variety of modes and levels to choose from

CONS:

OVERALL:
-Has a lot of potential to becoming an even better game

-Worth the $10 spent

reviewText:
I played this game, it was good for the first 5 minutes but then I noticed it has problems which has put me off.

Pros:

- Very well optimised
- Very smooth movement/no clunkyness
- Easy to learn
- Kills boredem easily

Cons:

- Shotgun is rediculously overpowered, everyone and their mother uses it because it's the easiest to get kills.
- Flamethrower doesn't do anything
- All latency/ping" reporting is broken in server list and player list. It says both my friend and I have less than 100ms even though he's from the UK and I'm Australia
- The game is dead

reviewText: I do reccommend this game because of its unique charm and simple but hard to master" gameplay.  You get 5 weapons which you get to switch from : the M16
hoursPlayed:
Shotgun and Sniper Rifle. It is 5v5 but some servers are bugged so you can get 10v10 or more. There are 10 maps EACH with their own game mode!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gamemodes:
Free For All
Team Death Match
Capture the flag (Traditional)
New Capture the Flag (Atleast I haven't seen it)
Light the Candles/ Defend the Candles
King of the Hill
Barnyard Ball (Not my favorite with more than 5v5 but still alot of fun with 5v5 or less)
Free the Dinosaurs (One of the most popular)
Defend the Cookies (Kinda like conquest in other games)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The graphics are great
voteText:
You feel like a plastic army man.
Also if you liked Army Men series of old then you will like this. (IF you didn't like sarge's heroes then you might not like this as it plays very similarly)
Community---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Well here is how I viewed the community over time:
Day 1 (release): Wow everyone is nice! Everyone is talking about how great the game is and remembering the old Army Men games. Cool
Day 2: Alright now we've found some bugs but still the Community is "small" and everyone just wants to talk and have fun!
Day 3: Okay the community has grown and people from other games are here.
Day 4: Wow people don't talk anymore. Lots of people getting kicked... Oh no....
Day 5+: How did everyone become so mean and sour... why do they want this game to have so many changes? Oh wow now its a "kicking" war going on. Yep half the lobby was kicked... great... Atleast the community is big right? :(
Notes====================================================================
They have promised updates and "Free DLC" (which in my mind is just a big update)
NO SINGLEPLAYER CONTENT YET"

reviewText:
Really great jump in and play gameplay, the environments are absolutely goergous and since they are matched with a wonderful soundtrack the world is just a pleasant place to be in.

The game modes are tied directly to whatever map you are playing which I think is a good thing, because it feels well thought out and everything is very easy to discover on your own without the need of any sort of tutorial.

The first thing you will notice right away is that the menu is SLEEK, and this definitely helps make you like the game right off the bat. The menu music is pleasant, the sounds feel good, everything is laid out properly and easy to fined. Although its just a menu this is a huge issue for me with a lot of modern games, which for some reason often have horrible menu screens. So a big plus here!

Major positives?
- The world feels alive and the theming of every map puts a smile on my face
- There are no balance issues that are presenting themselves after just a few hours of gameplay, everyone has access to the same 5 weapons at every point in the game. (Automatic rifle, with a lot of ammo and does mediocre damage/ Sniper with not too many bullets so you cant camp at the back of the map for long/ Shotgun that absolutely destroys up close/ Rocket launder that is a 1 hit K/O if you are at least close to the target, but only has 1 shot before having to wait a long time for another/ Flamethrower that is mostly used in objective game modes to light candles or melt ice, and has unlimited ammo)
- The different modes are unique yet easy to learn, it took me and my friend only half a round of operation birthday" to learn how to light or defend the candles on the birthday cake.
- sprinting feels good
date: and so does rolling.\n- You have a battery that shows the energy you have with jumping/sprinting/rolling all consuming the battery
recommended: which recharges at a good rate\n- Health regens after not getting hit for along time
hoursPlayed:
but it seems to only regen back to 50. Which means you aren't useless after a single 1v1 but you aren't healthy either.
- Grenades are fun to use but aren't strong enough to make you mad.

Negatives?
- Had a few instances of losing connection to host
voteText: but im gonna go ahead and blame that on the fact that it was launch day.\n- The shotgun does not sound as powerful as it should for the one shooting it. What I mean by this is that it is easy to tell when you are being shot at by a shotgun
helpfulPercent: as you can see the spray and the "ping" sound it makes
votesHelpful: but for some reason when you are shooting it
votesTotal:
there is little sound and since there is no screen shake of any kind its hard to tell if you shot it at times. (I think an easy fix would simply be to make the "ping" sound a little more pronounced.


Overall Would definitely recommend the game

reviewText:
Really fun game! If you've ever played All Points Bulletin, the shooting feels a bit like that (3PS feel). Definitely has a competitive aspect to it, but it's more CSGO style, compared to Quake or UT. The competitiveness lies in how well you can work as a team to complete the map objectives, and has less emphasis on your individual skill.

Do keep in mind the game is a 2015 title made with UE4... so you'll need a beefy computer to max out the settings. My computer is around 5 years old (worth $1000 at the time), and I can only play the game on all Low settings, or else I lag in full server games.

The devs are excited and have some nice updates planned. I recently came across a friendly dev in-game. The toy army soldier theme was pulled off really well! I highly recommend buying this game if you like shooters!

reviewText: ehh... i'm mixed om this.   I love the concept for this game.  Play as little green (or tan) army men, and battle it out.  Fight in places all around your house, ( bathtub, freezer, fishtank, ect)  However, the gameplay itself is pretty lacking.  Idk if it's just me, but i can't seem to aim for crap.  (litteraly miss when i aim point blank with a shotgun)  I also have the majority of the settings on low quality and the fps still doesn't improve too much ( i think i have a reasonable comp for this)  and when i do, the buildings n such might as well be cardboard boxes.  Like i said, love the concept, hate the delivery.\n\nScore 4/10
